file_content.text: You are always welcome here, my Jedi friend.
Odumis told me that the elixir was destroyed. You did well, Jedi.
You look well, Jedi. I'm glad the Flesh Raiders didn't hurt you.
Did you destroy the dark elixir?
Yes.
Odumis tried to bribe me to leave the elixir intact. But yes--I destroyed it.
Your guard captain wanted it.
Odumis wanted the elixir for himself, I suppose? You needn't tell me--I can guess.
His encounter with the Flesh Raiders addled his mind. I will attend to him. In the meantime, thank you.
It was pointless.
You've rid the world of an evil thing. The Flesh Raiders may brew their dark elixir again, but we won't make it easy.
I'm sure you won't. You strike me as resourceful.
No doubt.
Perhaps in our own way.
The Jedi will be here if you need support. We won't abandon you.
And we'll help however we can.
You are kind.
It would be simpler just to leave Tython.
You should flee.
Simpler, yes--but not easier. This is our home, and we must protect it.
I am grateful for what you've done. Take this gift with my blessing.
For now, I leave you in peace.
Odumis tells me you are reporting to him, now. Perhaps it is best that the Jedi work with our warriors.
Come to me again when the Flesh Raider elixir is destroyed.
Come over here, Jedi, and spare a moment for a humble servant of the Matriarch. I promise, your other dealings will wait.
My name is Vederiat Ayon. I minister to the bodies and spirits of the villagers... and I have a request.
Did the Matriarch ask you to talk to me?
Who's the request from?
No, but my request is in alignment with the Matriarch's wishes.
Very well.
Why should I waste my time with you?
Give me a reason to listen.
Because the Pilgrims and the Jedi share a grim fate on Tython, and we must work together now.
I speak of the Flesh Raiders. Of late, we've seen them growing stronger--and I know why.
What are the Flesh Raiders, exactly? Where did they come from?
What's their story, anyway?
No one's sure. They were here when the Pilgrims came to Tython.
I'm listening.
It doesn't matter how strong they get. The Jedi can handle them.
They're no threat to Jedi.
Perhaps. But we cannot, and so I ask for your aid.
The Flesh Raiders have been experimenting--concocting an elixir that makes them ravenous.
The ones who drink it go mad. Their lips froth, and they pounce like starving animals. It's black medicine--primitive and evil.
How could Flesh Raiders learn to do something like that?
They're manufacturing elixirs?
I have no idea. Such wickedness is beyond our comprehension.
You're sure?
One of our warriors was captured by the Raiders. He escaped and told me what he learned as I tended his wounds.
Are all Pilgrims this superstitious?
This is foolish.
Explain the process however you like--I'm no scientist--but the result remains the same.
We lack the numbers to attack the Flesh Raiders directly, and not even the Jedi could wipe the monsters from this world.
But with our warriors' help, the Jedi could reach the Flesh Raider caves and destroy their vats of elixir.
I'll do it.
Do I get paid?
Help, and I'll offer what I can in return for your time.
The Jedi could probably do that. The Jedi can do many things.
Possible, I suppose.
Must I put it more clearly? Help us destroy the Flesh Raider elixirs.
I won't beg. But understand, this is for your people, too.
Oh, very well.
Then I am grateful.
I'll make sure the elixir is destroyed.
It will be done.
Thank you for this.
Odumis Mer knows where the vats are hidden. He is our guard captain. Talk to him to learn the Raiders' secrets.
No more. [Refuse quest]
Very well. We will find another way.
You are welcome in the village of the Pilgrims, but I cannot help you.
I do need a Jedi... but I do not know if you are ready.
